meanings.definition: A type of fat found in the blood.
meanings.sent1: Triglycerides can be measured in a blood test.
meanings.sent2: High levels of triglycerides in the blood can increase the risk of heart disease.
meanings.sent3: The doctor joked that my blood was full of triglycerides after all the junk food I ate.
meanings.sent4: Her bloodstream flowed like a river of triglycerides, carrying energy to every cell.
meanings.sent5: The image of triglycerides floating in the blood stuck in my mind like a stubborn stain.

meanings.definition: A compound consisting of three molecules of fatty acids bound to one molecule of glycerol.
meanings.sent1: Triglycerides are essential for storing energy in the body.
meanings.sent2: When you eat, your body breaks down food into triglycerides for energy.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen experiment resulted in a sticky mess that resembled triglycerides under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: In the world of cells, triglycerides are like tiny energy-packed parcels waiting to be delivered.
meanings.sent5: The process of converting food into triglycerides is like packing suitcases full of energy for later use.
